definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: She flounced out of the room.
When the bell rang, I bolted from the schoolhouse.
sentences.chinese: 铃响了，我冲出了教学楼。

sentences.english: As the car drove up to the door, he flew out to meet his son.
sentences.chinese: 当车子开到门口时，他飞也似地冲出去接他儿子。

sentences.english: The team members raced out of the storage unit.
sentences.chinese: 蓝队队员们冲出储藏区。

sentences.english: When the bell rang, the pupils ran helter-skelter out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 下课铃响时，学生们蜂拥冲出门去。

sentences.english: Only off Seal Island do 16-foot great white sharks regularly catapult themselves into the air in an effort to catch and kill these seals.
sentences.chinese: 在海豹岛附近海域，大白鲨常会从水中冲出猎杀海狗。

sentences.english: In a flash he rushed out of the room without being seen.
sentences.chinese: 就在那一刹间，他冲出房间，没有被人发现。

sentences.english: Suddenly he scooted out of the room.
He had rushed out before I could stop him.
sentences.chinese: 我还没来得及拦住他他就冲出去了。

sentences.english: Other students rushed out of the classroom, but she kept behind.
sentences.chinese: 其他同学都冲出了教室，但她留在了后面。

sentences.english: The now-clean cat will rocket out of the toilet, and run outside where he will dry himself.
sentences.chinese: 焕然一新的猫将冲出马桶，跑到屋外把自己弄干。

sentences.english: When the sergeant yelled out my number, I had to rush forward.
sentences.chinese: 中士一喊出我的号，我就得立刻冲出去。

sentences.english: A large number of reporters waiting outside the hospital didi, discharge ShangHeng belt she rushed out of the trap.
sentences.chinese: 大批记者在医院外等候迪迪出院，尚恒带她冲出重围。

sentences.english: Buy the right car now, and you'll have no trouble outrunning the zombie apocalypse when it comes.
sentences.chinese: 趁现在买辆好车，好在僵尸来袭时冲出重围。

sentences.english: It is suddenly flying backward, staring directly down its barrels at the ships pursuing it.
sentences.chinese: 接着突然向后冲出，炮管直指追来的战机。

sentences.english: Mandy rose, bolted up the narrow stairs toward the street.
sentences.chinese: 曼迪起身，从狭窄的楼梯冲出朝街道冲去。

definition: to get into/to dig into (studies, job etc)/to squeeze into
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
to go straight to/to make a beeline for
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
to run away/to flee in disarray
